value: currency=Sealand dollar (pegged in value to USD)

is a sea fort in the North Sea, located 10 km off the coast of

. It is best known for its (unrecognized) claim to be the world's smallest sovereign nation. However, it is currently regarded as a micronation by most non-Sealanders, despite its cult internet 'fanbase'.

Visiting the fort is incredibly difficult, and tourism has been practically prohibited since 2002. If you can gain an entry visa, it should cost $100 Sealand dollars. The return transfer from Suffolk costs SX$120 and a day trip/one-night/two-night stay (full board) costs SX$100/200/300 per person.
Walk. The entire habitable area of the fort is 550 sq.m.
The sea, the fort and the English coastline.
Sealand possesses panoramic views of the sea due to its location, and with little else to do, observing the surrounding water is a common pastime.
Online Sealand has a comprehensive catalog of all things Sealand. This includes T-Shirts, coins, postage stamps, and even lordships.
You may sleep at the only accommodations on the island, the fort. This is included in your visiting fee.

There are no medical facilities whatsoever in Sealand. Should you encounter any difficulties while on the fort, bear in mind that you are quite a distance from the British mainland and that the authorities have very little experience of dealing with such incidents occurring here.
